critique: This executive order pertains to the hiring of family members of federal employees who have worked overseas. It allows for non-competitive appointments to competitive service positions within the US, potentially waiving written tests if the overseas duties were similar. This could be seen as slightly favoring a specific group (families of federal employees) but doesn't strongly align with any particular political ideology. It has a very slight impact on social inclusion, federalism, and economic regulation. It doesn't seem to touch on immigration or national security/civil liberties. The order itself delegates authority to the Director of the Office of Personnel Management, which is a fairly standard practice.
